snippet: In an effort to expand its corporate services offerings, Dell agreed to buy SonicWall, a provider of network and data security services for a wide array of corporations, in a deal that is said to be worth about $1.25 billion.
abstract: In an effort to expand its corporate services offerings, Dell agreed to buy SonicWall, a provider of network and data security services for a wide array of corporations, in a deal that is said to be worth about $1.25 billion.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Dell to Buy Security Services Provider for $1.25 Billion
